arm_group.description: All patients will receive 10 electroacupuncture sessions.
All patients will receive 10 placebo sham sessions.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether electroacupuncture is effective in the
      treatment of chronic tension-type headache, measured by Headache Impact Test, Visual
      Analogue Scale and biomarkers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune-Pineal Axis Function in Chronic Tension-Type Headache

detailed_description.textblock:
Tension-type headache can be defined as a constant sensation of pressure or heaviness, and
      is a highly-prevalent condition in the health services. The objective of the present study
      is to investigate the function of the immuno-pineal axis in chronic tension headache,
      focussed on the neuro-immune regulatory dysfunction. In addition, the effect of
      neuro-stimulation (electroacupuncture) on the function of this axis will also be studied.

      This is a clinical Trial study, randomised, in parallel, cross-over with a blinded assessor,
      and with a sham placebo control.

      The study will be carried out in the Clinical Research Outpatient Clinic of the Hospital de
      Clínicas de Porto Alegre (HCPA), with women aged between 18 and 60 years old. The
      participants will respond to questionnaires at the beginning and end of each therapeutic
      intervention, with 24-hour urine, blood and saliva collection. The therapeutic intervention
      will include: 10 electroacupuncture sessions and 10 sham placebo sessions. The measurements
      taken will be: quality of life, depression, impact of headache on daily life, sleep quality,
      chronotropic types, immuno-inflammatory mediators, levels of 6-sulfatoxymelatonin, and
      salivary cortisol.

      Through these interventions it is hoped that patients will present an improvement in their
      pain presentation, quality of life and sleep, as well as central autonomic regulation.
      Evidence for these hypotheses will support a minimally-invasive treatment, with few
      side-effects and a low cost.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women,

          -  Aged between 18 and 60 years old,

          -  Providing informed consent to participate in the study,

          -  Literate,

          -  Clinical diagnosis of Chronic Tension-Type Headache according to the International
             Headache Society.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Psychiatric or neurologic disorder that unable patient to consent and follow study
             protocol,

          -  De-compensated systemic disease,

          -  Chronic inflammatory disease (e.g. Systemic Lupus Erythematous, Rheumatoid
             Arthritis),

          -  HIV.

intervention.description: Placebo Sham is performed using electrodes, without electrical stimulation. Lights and sounds were identical to active treatment.

facility.name: Hospital de Clinicas e Porto Alegre (HCPA)

clinical_study.official_title: Immune-Pineal Axis Function in Chronic Tension-Type Headache: Noradrenergic Modulation and the Effect of Electroacupuncture

other_outcome.description: The BDNF and the TNF will be measured by ELISA.
other_outcome.time_frame: An expected average of 3 months. (At baseline and at the end of each intervention period).

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

primary_outcome.description: The intensity of pain was measured by a 10 cm VAS. The scores range from no pain (zero) to the worst possible pain (10 cm).
primary_outcome.time_frame: An expected average of 3 months. (At baseline and at the end of each intervention period).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre
responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, PhD, Professor and coordinator of Pain & Neuromodulation Lab

secondary_outcome.description: This test was developed in 2004, and has equivalent psychometric properties in nine languages, including Portuguese. It consists of six questions that assess the impact of headache on the ability to work, study, home and in social situations.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An expected average of 3 months. (At baseline and at the end of each intervention period).
